attributes.action: Make Mental Health First Aid a compulsory element of teacher training.
attributes.background: I'm Ben, I've set up this petition as part of a teenage mental health awareness campaign started after my brother, Sam West, tragically committed suicide aged 15 in January 2018. Your signature won't bring my brother back, but it could save someone else's life and that's all I want.
attributes.additional_details: Some teachers, who will remain anonymous, have reacted positively to the idea when it was put past them stating that teachers often won't act at all as they don't have the knowledge or confidence to deal with the situation. A compulsory course will provide the confidence to at least approach a student about their mental wellbeing and start working on a solution. This vital next move, which is cheaper than alternatives, can combat the ever-escalating problem which is teenage mental health.

attributes.action: Create a new tax and use the money to buy food for starving African children
attributes.background: Introduce a new tax and use the money to buy food for starving African children. I propose a small tax on all goods sold in England. The tax money will buy food for starving African children. Food security is very important, because when people have no money or food, eventually wars happen.
attributes.additional_details: Overall, 5.6 million children under age five died in 2016, nearly 15,000 daily. The risk of a child dying before five years of age is highest in Africa - about 8 times higher than in Europe. Eventually if other countries from around the world put a tax on their goods too, this international tax money would help collapsed economies from around the world, so it would be like a world social security ensuring the world to be a safer world to live in for everyone.

attributes.action: Remove home address from UK Driving Licence.
attributes.background: Most people carry their driving licence and house keys together.  Having your home address on the licence is unnecessary as all information will be attached to the licence number.  It's time to end this potentially dangerous practice.

attributes.action: GCSE Maths, English and Science should be optional from year 10
attributes.background: Many GCSE students will find the knowledge either difficult or pointless as there is so much to remember on top of the pressure from other subjects. Also other students may get bored and distract those who do want to take the subject in future potentially causing them to achieve lower.

attributes.action: Force employers to show salary and benefits on all advertised jobs
attributes.background:
All too often jobseekers find a job they would like to apply for, they apply, attend interview, receive a job offer and then are frustrated with a disappointing salary and benefits package.
Legislation should be introduced that will see all employers having to advertise the full benefits package.

attributes.action: All large Companies should have a Mental Health First Aider in the work place..
attributes.background: Make it mandatory for all large companies that employ more than 10 people to have a mental health first aider in the work place. This would help raise awareness and prevent discrimination to employees who suffer a mental health problem.

attributes.action: Make English Literature an optional subject for GCSE
attributes.background: Many students feel that learning quotations for novels that are outdated and not relevant to today's society is unnecessary and a waste of time, therefore making it an optional subject and replacing it with a lesson dedicated to life skills would prove to be much more useful for the students
attributes.additional_details: English Language should remain as a compulsory subject in the GCSE subject selection while English Literature should be optional as it is not a useful skill in later life. Furthermore, the amount that students are required to learn can be overwhelming for them and also requires significantly more effort relative to other subjects.

attributes.action: Ban the use of mobile phones in schools
attributes.background: Phones are causing children to soliaze less and less with each other and getting more and more attached to screens during break times and lunch times when they should be talking and playing. We should limit and control the amount of time our children spend on phones, especially at school.
attributes.additional_details: Banning mobile phones at school is the start to children socialising more rather than them being attached to screens all day. Schools should also have a say in this situation and should ban phones from the premises as it is destroying people’s lives by the havoc a small gadget can do

attributes.action: Stop Physical Education (PE) from being compulsory from Year 9 to Year 11
attributes.background: We'd like to stop teenagers from having to do physical education due to them being self conscious about their outward appearance and to allow them to focus on their GCSEs.

attributes.action: Make placenta and cord donation optional at all hospitals!
attributes.background: By donating your cord blood after the birth of your baby you could save someone's life. Any ladies can donate stem cells by giving away their umbilical cord and placenta after you have given birth. Stuff that's usually just put in a clinical waste bin and incinerated really could save a life.
attributes.additional_details: The only issues to this are only certain centres in the UK are using the fairly new scheme.

attributes.action: Stop the process of the European Union (Withdrawal) (No. 3) Bill 2017-19.
attributes.background: A Bill currently on the second reading stage in Parliament has been set out to force the government to seek an extenstion on Article 50, if a deal is not agreed in Parliament. I believe that this will not help things with brexit causing a lot more devision accross the country.
attributes.additional_details: I would like to see this Bill scrapped in the House of Commons as this hinders the vote of the British people.

attributes.action: Allow motorcyclists with a valid CBT (aged 17+) to have up to a 300cc.
attributes.background:
New motorcyclists from aged 17 are forced to ride up to a 125cc and have a maximum power output of 11kw. This is very low and can be unsafe, similar to mopeds as they're normally restricted to 28 MPH.

This limit has been proven unsafe in many circumstances and should be reconsidered.
attributes.additional_details:
https://www.quora.com/Are-125cc-motorcycles-good-for-beginners-or-should-one-choose-a-250cc-instead

Although the jump in power might seem ridiculous upon first viewing, but perhaps the government should look at how other countries treat new motorcyclists; along with additional training and theory.

We deserve more freedom and you can learn a lot more with the extra power, making it safer for riders and for them to gain advanced skills at an early stage.

We need more variation upon the market.

attributes.action: Hold a new Brexit referendum at the next General Election if UK has not left EU
attributes.background: In the event that the UK has not yet left the EU by the time that the next General  Election is called, a new referendum on U.K. membership of the European Union (Brexit) should be held. Voting should take place at the same time as choosing a Member of Parliament, but with a separate ballot.
attributes.additional_details:
Brexit negotiations are causing instability in Parliament. The chances of a leadership challenge, or a vote of no confidence, are high. This could trigger a General Election.

If the British public are to be subjected to yet another General Election before we have formally left the EU, the opportunity should be taken to run a new, better “Brexit” referendum.

This will stop campaigning, and the outcome of an election, being misrepresented as a Brexit mandate, when it is in fact a vote for an MP.

attributes.action: Start school at 9am and finish at 5pm to introduce children to the working world
attributes.background: Some believe that children and teenagers should be afforded the luxury of starting school at 10am. School hours should reflect the working world instead.

attributes.action: Allow a (paid) day off for women on their first day of menstruation
attributes.background: On the first day of a women’s period (menstruation), while some only experience bleeding, unfortunately many experience severe additional symptoms. It is a hard, painful and therefore unmotivating day for those starting their monthly period and already causes thousands of women to take time off.
attributes.additional_details:
Many women, as well as heavy bleeding , get additional, sometimes severe, symptoms such as abdominal and back cramping, headaches, muscle and joint pain, sickness, etc. And additional symptoms, like fainting, due to other health problems like anemia.
Menstruation for many women make school/work days almost unbareable, it is extremely stressful and hard to concentrate. Many women already feel the need to take days off or go home due to this, where they can allow their body to rest.

attributes.action: Bring Finland’s ‘National Jealousy Day’ to the UK
attributes.background:
In Finland taxes are made public on the same day. Every citizens tax details are released, everyone will be able to see how much tax everyone else is paying. 
An open approach on tax will show tax dodging, the rich/poor gap, reduce gender pay differences, and much more. 
See additional sources.
attributes.additional_details: https://www.weforum.org/agenda/2018/11/finland-has-just-published-everyone-s-taxes-on-national-jealousy-day/

attributes.action: Make handling food without disposable gloves an offence
attributes.background: This is a petition to make handling food in the food industry without gloves an offence, reasons for this are; its disgusting and off-putting, it increases the risk of spreading germs and catching illness. Its unhygenic and needs to be changed.

attributes.action: Offer free DNA paternity tests after birth as the standard NHS procedure.
attributes.background: Approximately 20% of the men in the UK who get a paternity test turn out not to be fathers of their alleged children. A paternity DNA check should be offered for free at birth. It should also be offered if a mother claims that someone is the father after some time passes since the birth.
attributes.additional_details: Nowadays it is easy, fast and cheap to make a DNA paternity test. If the paternity test results with a negative result, the man should have a choice to avoid any legal/financial responsibility and owe no alimonies whatsoever, unless he consciously chooses to accept the child as his own (whilst being fully aware that it was conceived by someone else).

attributes.action: Outlaw all Premium and Higher rate telephone charges for mobiles and landlines.
attributes.background: Not all numbers are classified as Premium rates yet incur extortionate charges. Some Premium calls are regulated but some are not. The most vulnerable in society incur these charges. The proposal therefore is that all these telephone numbers, whether presently regulated or not are outlawed.

attributes.action: Ban the sale of 7.5% Cheap White Cider which is highly addictive and deadly!
attributes.background:
White Cider is likened to the 'heroin' of drinks. It is so cheap and widely available, it is popular with those in society that have very little income.
Cheap White Cider is easy to produce from imported apple juice, so does not impact the British Cider Industry.
attributes.additional_details:
Just a few examples........
https://www.walesonline.co.uk/news/wales-news/terribly-sad-story-victim-cheap-15105742
https://www.mirror.co.uk/news/uk-news/16-year-old-girl-died-9864006
https://www.dailymail.co.uk/news/article-4248242/Teenager-16-died-bingeing-3-49-cider.html
https://www.theguardian.com/society/2017/nov/12/super-strength-cider-lager-killer-on-britain-streets-homelessness-rough-sleepers
https://www.theguardian.com/lifeandstyle/2011/apr/17/cider-industry-protected-expense-alcoholics

attributes.action: Declassify first class carriages on all rush hour trains
attributes.background: Given the rising cost of train travel, it’s utterly unacceptable that hard-working commuters aren’t guaranteed a seat. Declassifying first class carriages can at least alleviate the issue. It is archaic, and totally unjustifiable when commuters are literally falling over each other in standard class

attributes.action: Urge the Nigerian Government to release Sheikh Ibrahim Zakzaky from prison.
attributes.background:
Ibrahim Yaqoub El Zakzaky, is a Shia cleric who was arrested & imprisoned wrongfully in 2015  is still being detained despite the Federal High Court ordering his release on the 2nd of December 2016. 

As a result of his imprisonment, his health has deteriorated significantly.
attributes.additional_details:
Thousands of his supporters have been either arrested, abused and even killed for protesting and calling for his release. 

The conditions in which Sheikh Zakzaky has been in are inhumane, and something needs to be done urgently to assist him.

attributes.action: Allow Tier 2 (Intra-Company) individuals and their dependants to settle.
attributes.background: We have lived in the UK for 5 years and are not allowed to settle equally to colleagues on Tier 2 (general). Our parents are paying the same amounts of taxes, and not receiving any government services. It is not currently possible to apply for leave to remain with this visa made after April 2010.
attributes.additional_details: We have a private education and health insurance and aren't incurring expenses from the government. Our employment situation made UK our home, we grew up here and are about to enroll to universities; it is unreasonable to look elsewhere. Our parents are committed to careers in an international company; they will bring back their international earnings to UK to finance our education and settlement. As such, it is a win-win situation that merits consideration

attributes.action: Ban strip clubs in the UK. Strip clubs are demeaning and sexually exploitive.
attributes.background: Ban strip clubs in the UK. They are demeaning, degrading and sexually exploitive to women. Whilst these establishments exist they pose a major obstacle to achieving equality between the sexes. Strip clubs convey the idea that women can be bought and hold no value. It is well past time for change.
attributes.additional_details: Strip clubs have no place in a civilised society where equality should be the norm, not the exception. It is time for women to be treated with respect and valued for more than their bodies. Allowing such an industry to exist encourages sexual violence and exploitation to women. Let's adopt the icelandic approach and ban these outdated institutions. If society does not value women enough to ban this archaic display of sexism then how can we expect women to value themselves. It is time for change.

attributes.action: The UK legal definition of rape should change to the US version.
attributes.background: The UK law means only penetration with a penis is considered rape. Instead, the US version should be used. This covers all forms of forced penetration. Penetration from an object can cause the same trauma as when penetrated by a penis, yet these victims attackers can get off more lightly.
attributes.additional_details:
UK DEFINITION

https://www.legislation.gov.uk/ukpga/2003/42/part/1/crossheading/rape

Definition of rape - ( This version means only men can be charged and only when using their penis. )

"he intentionally penetrates the vagina, anus or mouth of another person (B) with his penis,
(b)B does not consent to the penetration, and
(c)A does not reasonably believe that B consents."


US DEFINITION 

https://www.justice.gov/archives/opa/blog/updated-definition-rape

Definition of rape - 

“The penetration, no matter how slight, of the vagina or anus with any body part or object, or oral penetration by a sex organ of another person, without the consent of the victim.”

attributes.action: Renegotiate the Brexit deal immediately in the event MPs vote against it
attributes.background: If MPs vote against the Brexit deal, the Government shall immediatley seek to negotiate an improved deal, including ensuring the U.K. will have a unilateral right to leave the customs union in the event of a backstop scenario thereby honouring the leave vote and working to avoid a “no deal” scenario
attributes.additional_details: The referendum vote to leave is compromised by the inability of the U.K. to unilaterally leave the customs union in the event of a backstop scenario. In the highly likely event MPs vote against the deal the Government must commit to return to the EU to negotiate an improved deal, for example to amend the Withdrawal Agreement to create a unilateral right to leave the customs union in the event of a backstop scenario and to reduce the Brexit bill; to be done immediatley and urgently after the vote

attributes.action: Ban estate agents from managing family members’ properties.
attributes.background: After 6 years of nothing but stress due to a "estate agent" who was related/family member to my landlord renting a badly maintenanced property to me. I want a law in place to protect people who private rent from being put in my place.
attributes.additional_details:
I want restrictions that stop relatives who are estate agents/letting agents renting out properties to people for family members.
 
Estate agents make money renting a place out so not only do they make a financial gain themselves but for their family this would be disallowed in other professions as conflict of interest. 
This also gives the issue I had the place was in disrepair and the estate agent was the manager disregarded any laws in place to protect me as a Tenant to help his family.

attributes.action: Ban strobe lighting to reduce the risks of epileptic seizures.
attributes.background: So many people are forced to turn away, close their eyes or even have others to protect them. It also prevents us to do something that normal people can do e.g. concerts. By banning strobes we would be reducing the risks of seizures and enable us to do something that anyone else could do.
attributes.additional_details: Being an epileptic myself, I know how it feels when we're unable to do something with friends or family, to describe it in anyway possible you feel alone. I would love to be able to do specific things such as concerts or horror mazes without having to wear sunglasses or close my eyes. If a seizure does occur in someone because of strobe lighting it can be fatal (SUDEP) to reduce this risk would be a major step forward. Many kinds of symptoms occur from epilepsy such as memory loss and depression.

attributes.action: Require all co.s  to have transparent complaints procedures & call waiting times
attributes.background: Many companies do not want to undergo the trouble and expense of engaging with their customers. Where customers have limited choice, there is limited recourse for customers, who have received a poor service or no service at all.
attributes.additional_details: A flight in July was cancelled by Easyjet. They have not paid compensation that is due. I have called four times and been kept waiting on each occasion more than half an hour, listening to a recording that blames 'unusual call volumes'. On the one occasion I spoke to a human, they explained that the systems were down and terminated the call.

attributes.action: Change House of Commons rules so MPs can call each other by their names
attributes.background: Enough is enough, we the people demand this reform in the houses of parliament.

attributes.action: Pause further UK North Sea Oil and Gas Decommissioning Until 2040.
attributes.background:
The UK has already met and exceeded its EU 2030 co2 emissions reduction target of  40% reduction on 1990 levels.
There are 11.7bn barrels oil in existing  UK wells, worth £724.581Bn.
It is irrational to pay $80 per barrel to import a resource that we have. Decommissioning should be paused til 2040
attributes.additional_details:
OIL is and will remain necessary for 60m tonnes per year European plastics industry. Fuel extraction currently supports 320 000 UK jobs.Oil import supply/price is vulnerable to global instability.
sources:
http://www.thenational.scot/news/16059661.north-sea-set-for-oil-boom-as-estimates-are-increased-by-billions-of-barrels/
https://oilandgasuk.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2017/10/Workforce-Report-2017-Oil-Gas-UK.pdf
https://www.statista.com/statistics/282732/global-production-of-plastics-since-1950/

attributes.action: Label all ingredients (including soy oil) and create a soy tax
attributes.background: There are many people suffering from multiple food allergies, soy being one of the main culprits. It is hidden under more than 70 different names. I myself have purchased a product labelled 100% turkey and ended up in hospital because soy oil was not labelled. Allergies need to be taken seriously.
attributes.additional_details: I have emailed the supplier of this product and all they have done is acknowledge they had soy oil in the product and offered a £4 refund. This is not enough. I was ill for a month. This is serious. Prepackaged food is over processed and has added soy in for no beneficial reason other than the fact it is a cheap alternative for the manufacturers. There is a sugar tax in action and I think there should also be a soy tax.

attributes.action: Pass the Restroom Access Act 2005 (Ally's Law) in the UK
attributes.background: The Restroom Access Act 2005 is an act in the USA that requires establishments that have toilet facilities for their employees to also allow customers to use the facilities if the customer suffers from an inflammatory bowel disease or other medical conditon requiring immediate access to a toilet.
attributes.additional_details: There is not enough awareness of IBD in the UK, hopefully signing this petition will help bring out this awareness and pass the Act.

attributes.action: Impose mandatory funeral funding clause upon private pension providers.
attributes.background: When my partner's father passed on, his family struggled to pay the cost of his funeral, in spite of not applying for the funeral funding payout from the job centre, which they were eligible for. We see non-UK nationals work lifelong, only to see their families impoverished by the cost of funerals.
attributes.additional_details: Families of nationals and non-UK nationals that provide an excellent service to the country are often left in a position where they cannot apply for state funeral funding because of the UK benefits system and its applications toward specific situations. Time of death cannot be predicted but private pension pay-ins are lifelong and should fund a funeral, which is the most costly part of some people's lives. The saddest day of one's life should never also be the most internally destructive.

attributes.action: Increase the standard fine and points for driving in closed motorway lanes.
attributes.background: Despite radio ads, we still often see drivers waiting til the very last second to move out of closed lanes with a red X, often passing through a mile or so of warnings. Those caught in the accident and the police/ambulance service are put at risk by the idiocy of people in a hurry.
attributes.additional_details:
The current fines are either not charged, or aren't an adequate deterrent for vehicle users to not use them. Suggested alternatives - as the Highways Authority are informed of where an accident may be and which lanes to close, suggest turning on any cameras available to catch people. The cameras only need be turned on when the lane is closed.

If caught, increase the fine to £150 and 6 penalty points. Alternatively, for each gantry driven through with a red X give them the standard fine.

attributes.action: Create an ombudsman for the travel industry
attributes.background: At the moment when a person has a complaint regarding the travel industry the only person they can complain to is the travel member or ABTA. If there was an ombudsman appointed then the customer would stand a better chance of being helped by someone who is independent.

attributes.action: Mental health checkups should be completed yearly from a young age on the NHS
attributes.background: Mental health checkups through the NHS should be followed out just as physical health checks are done yearly from a young age.

attributes.action: Keep the tornado in a flying order
attributes.background: The Panavia  tornado has been flying for many years for the golf war and has saved many lives so at least we can do is give a preservation of flying order to it this means to keep it in flying so it won't be scrapped and forgot we have done the same for ww2 aircraft let's do it for the future
attributes.additional_details:
Gulf war - 1991
Kosovo war 
Bosnian war
Iraq war
Libyan Civil war

Also involved with

 afganistan
 Syria

attributes.action: Help fund the NHS so people can have (Otoplasty-Pinnaplasty) surgery.
attributes.background:
I would like to have cosmetic surgery as my ears stick out a bit,  I’ve been to my doctors and seen different doctors and they said I might not be accepted due to funding and not have a good case.

I suffer from Body Dysmorphic Disorder and severe depression, having  ears pinned would help a bit.
attributes.additional_details:
People who need and would like to have Otoplasty surgery can’t get it done due to NHS not funded enough. It costs too much going private and either myself and/or other people who want Otoplasty can’t afford it. It’s not right that myself or others would have to go private. The cost is about £2,500-£3,500 plus any consultations etc.

I want to get this done as it’s causimg me significant Psychological distress and others feel the same. I don’t want to go privately to get cosmetic surgery.

attributes.action: Proscribe the Bangladesh Chhatra (Student) League
attributes.background: Members of the Bangladesh Chhatra (Student) League have been attacking people, including women, elderly, indigenous peoples, students.
attributes.additional_details:
We appeal for peace and justice and that is why we are reaching out to international community to find avenues to protect children of Bangladesh. We are seeking your help! To start with, Bangladesh Chhatra (Student) League needs to be recognized and proscribed by the UK as a terrorist organization.
 
https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-asia-45069935
 
http://www.foxnews.com/world/2018/08/04/police-protesters-clash-in-bangladesh-capital-many-injured.html”

attributes.action: Physician associate students should be able to apply for full student finance
attributes.background: PA students  should be able to apply for full student finance such as Tuition fees maintenance loan and childcare, this is an intense course and students can not take part time jobs and most Nhs professionals joined this course had to leave work and there currently shortage in the nhs

attributes.action: All kids in Secondary School should have the choice to have P.E. as a lesson.
attributes.background:
Kids from Year 7 to Year 11 should have the choice to do P.E. or not.
Reason because the P.E. kit for most schools are to expensive and some parents can't afford it so kids should have the choice about P.E. Kids can either chose to not have P.E. as a lesson or they can have the chose to do it.
attributes.additional_details:
Kids from Year 7 to Year 11 should have the choice to do P.E. or not.
Reason because the P.E. kit for most schools are to expensive and some parents can't afford it so kids should have the choice about P.E. Kids can either chose to not have P.E. as a lesson or they can have the chose to do it. Because it's to much money for parents witch means kid are getting detention for not haveing there P.E. kit so it would be mutch appreciated if you sign this petition and make it a thing.

attributes.action: Legalise hare coursing
attributes.background: Hare coursing is a traditional sport and was made illegal. However banning it has led to an increase in offences such as poaching. If it were to be made legal again it would be much more convenient to farmers, police and all others.

attributes.action: Increase donations to food banks by forcing schools to give away uneaten food
attributes.background: In the UK, £13,000,000 of food is thrown away daily. This is unnecessary and wasteful. There are many people who are in great need of substantial meals and schools in particular could easily reduce their environmental impact and help those in need by donating to food banks at the end of each day.

attributes.action: Allow 14-16 Year olds to be payed £4.50 minimum wage
attributes.background: A 14 year old might only get paid around £3 an hour for working in a busy restaurant. This isn’t fair when older people get paid more for doing the same.

attributes.action: Introduce KS2 SATs Science to ALL primary schools
attributes.background: This will help children know more knowledge about science for Secondary School.

attributes.action: Sanction Turkey until military action against Kurd groups in Rojava stops
attributes.background: Military action against Kurdish groups in Rojava must end. Turkey's allies should help the Kurds and not fuel the attackers. The UK must impose sanctions on Turkey until they stop military action against Kurdish groups in Rojava.

attributes.action: Urge international effort to move orphans from Idlib to safety, within 3 months!
attributes.background: Children are dying freezing, hungry, orphaned. This is a international disgrace and a blight on the conscious of all humanity!

attributes.action: New legislation that employers must grant paid time off work for a smear test
attributes.background: The attendance of smear tests is declining year on year however the rates of women in the work place are increasing year on year. A recent review of data shows that a majority of women workers are in low paid and part time work. There is also the issue of zero hour contracts.
attributes.additional_details: Paid appointment leave is at the discretion of the business you work for. Women on a zero or part time contracts are less likely to take unpaid appointment leave or time off work.1 - because this will have a financial impact on them. 2 - this could be the only hours they were offered in the week.3 - their appointment could be scheduled at an unsuitable time - no fault of their own. eg, 3pm women are likely to want to freshen up after a morning at work before attending such appointment.

attributes.action:
Ban alcohol advertising.
Label all alcohol with correct health & safety warning
attributes.background: I started drinking alcohol from a young age without any advice or warning of the dangers of this addictive drug. It has caused me much misery and I have witnessed much misery. There needs to be more education to help save lives to help save our children.
attributes.additional_details: Alcohol kills around 3 million people a year. It destroys lives, it destroys relationships. It is an addictive drug and shouldn’t be advertised. It shouldn’t be attractively packaged and should be labelled with all the health and safety warnings. We need to help save future generations.
